Name: Aersol Paint, Grafitti Proof Containers
Title: A Local Law to create a temporary task force to study the feasibility of graffiti proof aerosol spray paint containers.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
	Section 1. a. There is hereby established a temporary task force to advise the council and the mayor as to the technological and economic feasibility of graffiti proof aerosol spray paint containers as a method of reducing graffiti in New York City.
	Such task force shall be comprised of seven members, three of whom shall be appointed by the speaker of the council and four of whom shall be appointed by the mayor, one of whom shall serve as chairperson. The members of the task force shall be appointed within thirty days of the effective date of this local law and shall serve without compensation. The task force shall have a duration of twelve months.
	b.For the purposes of this section, "graffiti proof container" shall mean any aerosol spray paint container designed or constructed to be significantly difficult for persons to create graffiti, in a manner that severely limits the ability of persons to use spray paint in public or on the property of another without consent, yet allows for the product's lawfully intended use in or near homes or places of business.
	c.Not later than sixty days after the expiration of the temporary task force, it shall submit a report containing its conclusions and recommendations to the mayor and the city council.
	ï¿½2.This local law shall take effect thirty days after its enactment.





_______
Note: Matter in italics is new; matter in brackets [ ] to be omitted.
